channel.title: My Final SDS348 Project
channel.description: Recent content on My Final SDS348 Project

item.description: #Title: SDS 348 Project: 1 Exploratory Data Analysis #Author: Tu Hoang (tah2957) #Date: 10/20/2019 — Introduction The two dataset that I have decided to use for this Explorartory Data Anaylsis is a dataset named bad_drivers and another data set named USCancerRates. At first glance, these two dataset don’t have anything in common since one dealt with Cancer rates and the other dealt with factors contributing to inattentive drivers. I’ve decided to use this two dataset because I wanted to see if there was a plausible correction between inattentive drivers and cancer rates.

#Title: SDS 348 Project: 2 Modeling, Testing, and Predicting #Author: Tu Hoang (tah2957) #Date: 11/27/2019 — bad_drivers2<-bad_drivers%>%pivot_longer(cols = c("insurance_premiums","losses"), names_to = "PPIL", values_to="Cost(IP & L)") glimpse(bad_drivers2) ## Observations: 102 ## Variables: 8 ## $ state <chr> "Alabama", "Alabama", "Alaska", "Alaska", "Arizon… ## $ num_drivers <dbl> 18.8, 18.8, 18.1, 18.1, 18.6, 18.6, 22.4, 22.4, 1… ## $ perc_speeding <int> 39, 39, 41, 41, 35, 35, 18, 18, 35, 35, 37, 37, 4… ## $ perc_alcohol <int> 30, 30, 25, 25, 28, 28, 26, 26, 28, 28, 28, 28, 3… ## $ perc_not_distracted <int> 96, 96, 90, 90, 84, 84, 94, 94, 91, 91, 79, 79, 8… ## $ perc_no_previous <int> 80, 80, 94, 94, 96, 96, 95, 95, 89, 89, 95, 95, 8… ## $ PPIL <chr> "insurance_premiums", "losses", "insurance_premiu… ## $ `Cost(IP & L)` <dbl> 784.
